FuncDef: The display virtual-cluster-access vc interface command displays VC information.
Examples: VC State           : Up         AC State            : Up
Local VC Label     : 32860      Remote VC Label     : 19
Local VC MTU       : 1500       Remote VC MTU       : 1500
Local Control Word : Disable    Remote Control Word : Disable
Create Time                  : 0 days, 0 hours, 0 minutes, 49 seconds
Up Time                      : 0 days, 0 hours, 0 minutes, 49 seconds
Last Change Time             : 0 days, 0 hours, 0 minutes, 49 seconds
VC Total Up Time             : 0 days, 0 hours, 0 minutes, 49 seconds
ExtraInfo: After you configure virtual cluster access, run the display virtual-cluster-access vc command to view VC information. The information includes the establishment, allocation, and forwarding entries of the VC. You can use the information to check configurations and locate faults.
